metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11070 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit prior to version 2.24.1 failed to properly apply configured HTTP proxy settings when downloading livestream video (HLS, DASH, or Smooth Streaming), an error resulting in deanonymization. This issue was corrected by changing the way livestreams are downloaded.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.24.1-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.24.1-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.24.1-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.24.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.24.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.24.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.24.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.24.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.24.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.24.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.24.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.24.1-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.24.1-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.24.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24.1-1').
